name: src/config.js
APP_PREFIX
description: A prefix for use for custom event, attribute, and element names

name: MVC_OBSERVES
description: A custom attribute which directs the view to observe a particular value of the model

name: MVC_CONTROLS
description: A custom attribute which directs the view to update a particular value of the model

name: MVC_RADIO_GROUP
description: A custom attribute which ensures that events are triggered properly for radio inputs

name: MVC_CHECK_GROUP
description: A custom attribute which ensures that events are triggered properly for checkbox inputs

name: MVC_MODEL_MODIFIED
description: A custom event name for when multiple properties of a model have been modified

name: MVC_PROPERTY_CHANGED
description: A custom event name for when a single property of a model has been modified

name: MVC_INPUT_CHANGED
description: A custom event name for when an input in a View has been updated

name: MVC_VIEW_ELEMENT
description: The name of the custom element defined by MVCView
experimental: this may be deprecated in the future

name: src/custom-elements/mvc-view.js
MVCView
description: This class is a custom HTMLElement that provides some syntactic sugar for setting up Views and Models
experimental: This class is an experimental featue, and may not be valid in the future

name: constructor
description: Simply call the super() constructor

name: connectedCallback
description: Adds a form around the content slot

name: model
description: Return the model for the view. May be null if model has not been supplied yet.

name: model
description: Set the model the view will observe and modify.

params.name: model
params.description: An object to be turned into an MVC Model

name: _model
description: The Model instance encapsulated by this element

name: _view
description: The View instance encapsulated by this element

name: src/event-emitter.js
EventEmitter
description:
The EventEmitter class is modified from a snippet by MDN Contributers at 
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/EventTarget#_Simple_implementation_of_EventTarget 
Any copyright is dedicated to the Public Domain. http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/ 

This enables custom classes to dispatch events, and is used by micro-mvc to establish observers
and fulfill the Model-View-Controller design pattern

name: constructor
description: This class is intended to be extended or composed into other classes.

name: listeners
description: Listeners for each event type

name: addEventListener
description: Add an event listener

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to execute upon occurence of the event

name: removeEventListener
description: Remove an even listner

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to stop executing upon occurence of the event

name: dispatchEvent
description: Dispatch an event. Upon dispatching an event, all listeners are called

params.name: event
params.description: The `Event` that needs to be dispatched.

name: listensFor
description: Check whether the instance has listeners for the provided event type

params.name: type
params.description: The type of event to check for

return.description: true if there is a listener for this event type, otherwise false

name: hasListener
description: Check whether the instance has a specific listener for the provided event type

params.name: type
params.description: The type of event to check for

params.name: callback
params.description: The specific callback to check for

return.description: true if the callback exists for this event type, otherwise false

name: src/index.js
src/model.js
Model
description: This class encapsulates a basic Object and dispatches events when they are changed

name: constructor
description: Create a Model which can observe and be observed by supplying a raw data object and encapsulating it

params.name: dataModel
params.description: The raw data object to be encapsulated by the instance

name: _dataModel
description: the raw data object which is encapsulated by the event emitter

name: model
description: return the underlying _dataModel in its current state

name: dataModel
description: return the underlying _dataModel in its current state
experimental: This may be deprecated in the future to preserve the object's namespace

name: modify
description: assign multiple values to the dataModel, and dispatch an event.
experimental: This may be deprecated in the future to preserve the object's namespace

params.name: val
params.description: An object containing the values to be updated

name: src/view.js
View
description:
The View class is an EventEmitter that searches the children of the provided DOM object for custom attributes
which direct it to observe and/or update properties of the provided model object

name: constructor
description: The constructor searches the DOM object and attaches events to the model and the view

params.name: viewDOM
params.description: A DOM object with children that observe or control the values of the model

params.name: model
params.description: A model object of type Model to be observed and updated by the View

content:
# micro-mvc This package exposes two very basic classes that can be used create reactive MVC interfaces. Models are created from basic objects. Simply create an object with the desired properties, and instantiate the Model class with the object as the argument in the constructor: JavaScript ``` let Model = mvc.Model; let application = { name: 'My Application', version: '1.0.0' }; let applicationModel = new Model(application); ``` The `applicationModel` above will encapsulate the raw object and provide getters and setters for its properites. Setters for the properties will trigger events for which a View listens. Views are established from a DOM object and existing models. It is assumed that the DOM is left unfilled, and upon construction, the View with force the model to emit an event that fills in all the data: HTML ```

``` JavaScript ``` let View = mvc.View; let applicationContainer = document.querySelector('.application-container'); let applicationView = new View(applicationContainer, applicationModel); ``` [View the demo here](https://christophergorexyz.github.io/micro-mvc/demo/)
name: ./README.md
